name: Galactic Gunners
genres: Action > 1st-person > Shooter > Space flight > Sci-fi / futuristic
desc: Galactic Gunner is a shooting game where the player has to shoot down as many ships from an enemy space fleet as possible. The game is viewed from a first person perspective and it involves moving around a crosshair and then pressing the fire button when an enemy ship flies past it. The firing is not instant so the player has to anticipate the enemy's position. Space is full of dust clouds that the player's shots won't penetrate and when the enemy ship hides beneath them they have to wait it out. One enemy appears on screen at a time and when killed another will take its place. The game goes on till either the time runs out or the player has used all the 25 shots they have at their disposal. The player can choose between five skill levels and the scoring is dependent on this. Higher skill levels mean faster enemies and less time available. For each enemy shot down the player earns 10 times the skill level.

name: Gauntlet and Gauntlet II: Limited Edition
Gerry the Germ Goes Body Poppin'
Get Me to the Church on Time!
GLUF
genres: Action > Puzzle > Side view > Fixed / flip-screen > Platform > Direct control > Fantasy
desc: Gluf is a puzzle platform game whereby you guide Gluf the tesla frog across many single-screen platform floor panels in order to power them up and open up a portal to the next level. In order to light up the panels, Gluf must first charge upon the batteries located on each level, all whilst avoiding the various enemies. Each time you light up a panel, Gluf's power cell reduces by one unit and you will need to recharge if it completely drains. Gluf can not jump over enemies or platforms so must take the elevators to move to higher areas or to escape being hit. Some of the panels disintegrate under Gluf when touched a second time, which can both be a help and a hindrance.

name: GraviBots
genres: Action > Puzzle > Side view > Fixed / flip-screen > Arcade > Platform > Direct control > Sci-fi / futuristic
desc:
Gravibots is a platform game with elements of puzzle-solving and management. The main goal is to destroy all of the roaming bots present on each scenario by luring them into the pointed sides of the spikes which are distributed at specific points of the screen.

The only way to do this is to make use of both the fixed (in magenta) and the transportable (in green) gravitational traps which if placed or used correctly, will thrust the robots against the deadly side of the spikes. The portable traps may only be transported and used once. After being used they'll become magenta.

The scenarios are affected by gravitational forces which allow the player and the bots to move through both surfaces of the platforms without falling. If they are positioned at the lower sides of the platforms the vertical axis of the commands will be inverted.The gravitational traps may also be used to strategically thrust the bots between the surfaces of the platforms.

name: Great Escape, The
genres: Action > Diagonal-down > 2D scrolling > Isometric > Puzzle elements > World War II
desc:
The Great Escape is an isometric action-adventure game. Controlling a prisoner of war in a German camp, your goal is to break out undetected. There are numerous ways to freedom – back doors, cracked fences, even underground tunnels. However, you have to plan your escape while obeying the strict rules of the camp.

Number one: Daily program. You have to attend two roll calls a day, one meal, one exercise, and stay in bed at night. Failure to appear at any of these events will result in the alarm being rung. When you do not touch the controls, your protagonist will move automatically, going to all important events. You have to detect and use gaps in the time-table to explore the camp.

Rule number two: guard rooms are off limits. If a soldier catches you in a room that is forbidden, you will be placed in solitary confinement. Of course, you have to enter restricted parts of the camp to find items crucial for your escape. The moral flag will turn from green to red to indicate that you are in an area where you shouldn’t be.

Rule number three: no prisoner may carry forbidden objects. When you are caught in a suspicious situation, you will be stripped of all items that you found so far. To avoid that, you have to deposit objects in a safe place. You need to find keys to open locked doors, uniforms for camouflage, flashlights to see in dark tunnels, and many more.

Rule number four: guard commands are to be obeyed at all times. The German soldiers patrol on fixed routes and have a line of sight. You have to learn the guard’s routes and sneak past their backs to avoid detection when breaking out. If you are caught, your morale will decrease. If your morale reaches zero, your will to escape is broken.

name: Green Beret
genres: Action > Side view > 2D scrolling > Arcade > Platform > War
desc:
Depending on which title you use, and how you interpret it, this game is about a guy who a) rushes in before attacking b) attacks Russians (or is being attacked by Russians... in the mid-80s, when this game was produced, the Cold War was still in full effect), or c) wears a rather goofy hat. One way or another, this arcade game arms you with a knife and sends you on a kamikaze mission against hordes of enemy fighters.

There are four distinct sections of gameplay, taking in a Missile Base, a Harbour, a Bridge, and an enemy Prison Camp. Extra weapons with limited ammunition can be collected along the way, which will make the task a lot easier. The level is divided into 3 horizontal levels, which can be moved between either by jumping or using ladders, and this gives a chance to avoid the more threatening mobs of enemy fighters.

name: Grell and Fella
developer: The Big Red Software Company Ltd.

Guardian II: Revenge of the Mutants
